forkee.name: theia
forkee.description: Eclipse Theia is a cloud & desktop IDE framework implemented in TypeScript.

issue.title: Git plugin issue after network disconnection

labels.name: plug-in system
labels.description: issues related to the plug-in system

issue.body:
<!-- Please provide a detailed description of the bug. -->
<!-- Note: This template is not meant for security vulnerabilities disclosure -->
<!-- Any such issue, created in this repo, will be deleted on sight -->
<!-- Instead please report vulnerabilities to the Eclipse Foundation's security team -->
<!-- For more details, please read SECURITY.md in the repository root -->
### Bug Description:
Hi,
I am using the vscode git plugin (1.77.0). When the network connection is lost, and back online again, all the plugins are reloaded back. In this case, the git plugin open changes command stops working (double click on a changed file in the source control tree or context menu command 'open changes').
The error in console log:

```
023-08-10T13:57:02.602Z root ERROR Error: No reply handler for reply with id: 116
    at RpcProtocol.handleReply
    at RpcProtocol.handleMessage
```

<!-- Please provide clear steps to reproduce the bug. -->
### Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a project under git while using the vscode git plugin
2. do a change in a file
3. make sure that the source control tree shows this change, and double click on it will open the diff view
4. make a network disconnection and then reconnect back (if you are working on local machine, then use the 127.0.0.1 instead of loaclhost and using the devtools change the network from 'no throtlling' to 'offline' and then change it back to 'no throtlling')
5. while it is disconnected the status bar should be in offline mode (yellow) 
6. after getting online back, try to open the changes of the file.

<!-- Please provide any additional information available. -->
<!-- Additional information can be in the form of logs, screenshots, screencasts. -->

### Additional Information

- Operating System: mac/win
- Theia Version: 1.40

comment.body:
Hi,
Thank you for this detailed investigation...

I think also that this issue is the root cause of many other issues:
1. the plugin reload affects other plugins on disconnection, and some stop working as expected (not only the git plugin). Moreover, some took time to reload like the redhat java plugin causing bad UX.
2. Custom editors and webviews are fully reloaded causing some events to be broken and not functional after reconnect.
3. Custom editors will lose any unsaved data!
Thanks

issue.title: Maximum call stack size exceeded after install robot-lsp extension
issue.body:
<!-- Please provide a detailed description of the bug. -->
<!-- Note: This template is not meant for security vulnerabilities disclosure -->
<!-- Any such issue, created in this repo, will be deleted on sight -->
<!-- Instead please report vulnerabilities to the Eclipse Foundation's security team -->
<!-- For more details, please read SECURITY.md in the repository root -->
### Bug Description:

<!-- Please provide clear steps to reproduce the bug. -->
### Steps to Reproduce:

1.download theia blueprint from https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia-blueprint
2.execute yarn and yarn build, 
3.download robotframework lsp extension from https://open-vsx.org/extension/robocorp/robotframework-lsp
4.copy downloaded robocorp.robotframework-lsp-1.11.0.vsix to plugins folder
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/assets/4537809/32f475e6-aeea-4eb1-9db7-38bb6ef2d2ad)
5.select Launch Electron Backend & Fronted debug mode
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/assets/4537809/035bd0cf-e188-4417-ad5c-3c6201c115cc)
6.start debug and the debug console will output the error message
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/assets/4537809/97d6f476-9a99-4ab0-9685-d5e6ea213388)
7.open file explorer and right click any file, can not open context menu
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/assets/4537809/baa5d454-a696-4866-9467-ea3425a59923)


<!-- Please provide any additional information available. -->
<!-- Additional information can be in the form of logs, screenshots, screencasts. -->

### Additional Information

- Operating System:windows10
- Theia Version:1.41.1

### New Contributors :rocket: 
* @ozfox made their first contribution in https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/pull/12975

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/eclipse-theia/theia/compare/v1.42.0...v1.43.0

pull_request.title: docs: update changelog for `1.43.0`
pull_request.body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description and review
the requirements below.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/theia-ide/theia/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

Note: Security vulnerabilities should not be disclosed on GitHub, through a PR or any
other means. See SECURITY.md at the root of this repository, to learn how to report
vulnerabilities.
-->

#### What it does

<!-- Include relevant issues and describe how they are addressed. -->

The commit updates the changelog for the `1.43.0` release.
The changes include:
- updating the changelog with notable new features, improvements and bug fixes
- documenting any potential breaking changes
- fixing misc typos in the repo

#### How to test

<!-- Explain how a reviewer can reproduce a bug, test new functionality or verify performance improvements. -->

- confirm the content of the changes
- confirm that CI successfully passes

#### Follow-ups

<!-- Please list potential follow-up work, including known issues, possible future work, identified technical debt, and potentially introduced technical debt. If the PR introduces technical debt, specify the reason why this is acceptable. Please create tickets and link them here. Please use the label "technical debt" for new issues when it applies. -->

N/A.

#### Review checklist

- [x] As an author, I have thoroughly tested my changes and carefully followed [the review guidelines](https://github.com/theia-ide/theia/blob/master/doc/pull-requests.md#requesting-a-review)

#### Reminder for reviewers

- As a reviewer, I agree to behave in accordance with [the review guidelines](https://github.com/theia-ide/theia/blob/master/doc/pull-requests.md#reviewing)

issue.title: Can we split bundle.js to smaller files so browser can download those parallel and also hash the js file so it can be cached on browser side
issue.body:
Can we 
1. Split bundle.js to smaller files so browser can download those parallel.
2. hash the js file so it can be cached on the browser side? Currently, 304 request may take few seconds for us.

Since the bundle.js is very big, it would be better for performance.
